intro: Paepalanthus niveoniger, commonly known as the white-black marsh grass, is a member of the Poaceae family, characterized by its grass-like appearance. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Brazil. The plant typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and seasonally flooded areas. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, with a distinctive white and black coloration on the underside. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic organisms.
